bibl.title: Letter from R.A. Watson to Mabel H. Lazear, May 1, 1907

div1.p: Watson writes that he is trying to increase Mabel Lazear's pension.

div1.head: Letter from R.A. Watson to Mabel H. Lazear, May 1, 1907
div1.opener:
FRAME & CO.
______
Telegraphic Addresses:
“ADVANCE, NEW YORK.”
“FRAMEZZO, LONDON.”
A B C. Al & Lieber's Codes Used.
_____
ALSO AT
21 MINCING LANE, LONDON, E.C.
90-96 Wall Street,
New York, 1st May 1907
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear
Cal.
Dear Madame,
div1.p:
The enclosed letter
will explain to you what is
being done to secure for
you a slight recognition, I
say slight, because no payments
can adequately balance the account
between the American people, and
your late husband, his work
& sacrifice will forever leave
us all in your debt, but
I know You have the gratitude
of very many, who know of
his work.

I sincerely trust
we will soon hear of the
pension being granted
div1.closer:
Very truly Yours R. A. Watson Kindly return me the enclosed letter
R.A.
